html:
In downtown LA and on the internet

IGN Live was already confirmed to return this June, but now RPS's corporate papa has put a date on it. The in-person fan event, with streams for those who can't attend, will return on June 7th-8th in LA, and tickets are on sale now.

The event, which takes place amid the summer gaming onslaught previously marked by E3, is being held in downtown Los Angeles at Magic Box @ The Reef. Currently announced attendees include Netflix, 2K Sports, Lenovo and Arcade1Up, with more to be confirmed in future.

Tickets are now available to purchase via the IGN Live website. A single-day early bird ticket costs $15 if purchased before April 30th, with a $30 pass granting access to the entire weekend and also including a goodie bag valued at $40. Here are the full ticket details:

  • Early bird, single day tickets: $15
  • Early bird weekend/VIP tickets: $30
  • Regular pricing, single day tickets: $25
  • Regular pricing, weekend/VIP tickets: $40
  • Single day tickets at the door: $30
  • Weekend/VIP tickets at the door: $45

If you can't make it to LA in June, IGN will also be livestreaming the event across their website, YouTube, Twitch and other social channels.

Last year's IGN Live featured news and announcements from Microsoft, Ubisoft, Razer and Nvidia, among others.
